intro: Hieracium macrantheloides, commonly known as the large-flowered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, white to grayish hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with serrated edges and a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with prominent central disk florets. It thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, often forming dense colonies in meadows and woodland edges.
